thread.title: Court officer suffers broken jaw in scuffle with turnstile jumper
thread.title_full: Court officer suffers broken jaw in scuffle with turnstile jumper | New York Post

author: Daniel Prendergast
title: Court officer suffers broken jaw in scuffle with turnstile jumper
text:
A 16-year-old boy broke a Bronx court officerâ€™s jaw when he tried to stop the punk from entering a subway station without paying, police sources said.
The off-duty court officer, who is assigned to Bronx Supreme Court, had just entered the 161st Street/Yankee Stadium subway station when he saw the teen breeze through the emergency gate around 8:20 p.m. Tuesday.
When the officer identified himself and told the boy he had to pay the fare, the teen began punching him repeatedly in the face, breaking his jaw, police sources said.
The injured court officer managed to pepper spray the suspect and held him at gunpoint until police arrived and arrested him.
The officer was treated at Lincoln Hospital.
The teen, identified as George Yates, was charged with assault, sources said.
